intro: Psychotria peduncularis var. rufonyassana, commonly known as the red-stemmed psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green, with a distinctive corolla shape. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
